attributes.action: Push for UK to have parity with EU for pet passport rules.
attributes.additional_details: Since 1st January 2021 the UK pet passport is no longer valid. The UK has only been granted Part 2 Listed Status. This means that any person in the UK wishing to take their pet to the EU must now obtain an animal health certificate for every trip to the EU. This will incur a cost of upwards of £100 each trip. Pet owners in the EU, on the other hand, can still use their pet passport to enter the UK. This incurs no additional cost to them. This is obviously not fair. The government should seek parity with the EU on this matter.
attributes.background: Pet owners in the EU can still use their pet passport to enter the UK. This incurs no additional cost to them. This is obviously not fair. The government should seek parity with the EU on this matter.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Create a national system to provide animal health certificates at a fixed cost
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568802
